title: IronStylus, might I pick your brain?
body:
I saw you were talking about high society clothing as a good fit for Demacia and I'd have to agree.  I'd like to hear your takes on the other areas of the world though if you have a minute.  Clothing tells the story of a people after all.

We see that the people of the Freljord (and by extension the Woad skin line) all wear more rugged attire with furs and such.  The people of Shurima, what I can gather, all wear what you'd expect from desert folk, and those in Piltover all usually in steam-punk inspired clothes.

Can you offer some insights on what's going on with places like Noxus?  Not just from a champion perspective but from what you think the everyday citizen wears in that place.  Does everyone dress like a murderous cutthroat you think?  What about Bandle City?  What does the everyday person in Zaun wear?  What does a normal person on Targon wear?  Are clothes like Annie's, backpack and all, common place elsewhere you think?

I'm just curious and if you have the time, I'd love to hear your thoughts.

replies.body: Aaaacutally that's the purview of the artists from the Visual Development team. I believe Maisie from the team has posted before on here.. but I don't know her screen name.. I'll see if I can poke her tomorrow.

Oh cool then!  The only little bit we've seen so far was from Kalista's and Rek'Sai's promo vid, as well as the Harrowing promo.  I'm interested to hear what she has to say about other areas, and I'm sure other players are as well.

:( I typed a response out but the boards ate it by accident. 

Anyway, IronStylus gave me a heads up about this thread. Glad you enjoyed the tidbits in the videos! 

I can't speak to the specifics, but I feel as though Noxus wouldn't be comprised of just cutthroat murderers; they have an empire, and relatively sophisticated society. Case in point, the desk in Rek'sai's promo website belongs to a Noxian noblewoman. Certainly Noxians could kill you, but some of them could do it stylishly too ;) 

A while ago someone in this forum was asking about a Noxian bro (the counterpoint to Helmet bro) -- no specific timeline on this, but there's definitely somewhat of a Noxian 'look', and it's a decent bit more aggressive than helmet bro's helmet.  

Mt. Targon has always had a feeling of awe to it, and we're trying to enhance and preserve that, as well as avoid double-beats with the Freljord (due to both of them being located in cold-ish places).

Zaunians... are kind of badass, given that they thrive on things most other Runeterrans wouldn't deal with. They're probably grimy, and happy to be so.

What about Demacia?

> [{quoted}](name=Riot Whren,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=MpdZxVHa,comment-id=000000000000,timestamp=2015-02-14T03:20:02.362+0000)
> 
> Zaunians... are kind of badass, given that they thrive on things most other Runeterrans wouldn't deal with. They're probably grimy, and happy to be so.

I've always seen Zaun as basically Shadowrun/X-Men, at a somewhat lower tech level and a higher magic level. Corporate-run urban civilization, with a culture that combines greed, fun-loving, and recklessness. Hence the drugs, pollution, and assorted hextech disasters, but also the cool consumer culture and wild innovation. I see Piltover as being more like "let's make this train run 10% more efficiently than the previous version", while Zaun is like "let's find a way to teleport stuff across the city." Not that Zaun is "better" than Piltover; Piltover just has more of a traditional, gradualist approach, whereas Zaun is always pushing the edge, which doesn't always translate into overall better techâ€”just more exciting tech.

I think it's also nice that Zaun has a rather decentralized government, without a King or High Command to speak for the entire state.

So far only Jinx and maybe Janna have a Zaun theme of revealing/punk clothing.

You guys spend a lot of time developing Noxus. Is it due to popularity or because it hasn't been defined that well? It feels like Demacia only exists as a foil, and I'd love for it and Zaun to develop themselves.

We actually work on a whole bunch of factions at a time -- I just happen to have helped with Noxus, and it's my favorite faction, and I tend to lurk/post more than other members of my team. :) Demacia has a lot of developmental work done as well, don't worry!

> [{quoted}](name=Riot Whren,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=MpdZxVHa,comment-id=00000000000000030000,timestamp=2015-02-17T18:45:01.196+0000)
>
> Demacia has a lot of developmental work done as well, don't worry!

Well then.... should I be worried that all this content is being created without community interaction or involvement?  I mean, this is *exactly* the sort of thing that the creative teams should be gathering ideas about at *precisely* the right time to start collecting them... yet, it's all being done in seclusion, far away from the fans who care the most about it.

I mean, if you guys don't want fan input or interaction on this stuff, someone should at least say it so we can move on. After waiting three and a half years for some meaning dialogue, it's the very least that could be done.

Go make a thread about the factions you like and what you like about them. You can't expect to have Rioters glued to the forums picking our brains, they'd get *nothing *done. Try trusting them when they say they read the forums, even though you aren't getting the instant gratification of a response.

> [{quoted}](name=Solideus,realm=EUNE,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=MpdZxVHa,comment-id=0000000000000003000000000000,timestamp=2015-02-17T21:04:23.346+0000)

Try trusting them when they say they read the forums, even though you aren't getting the instant gratification of a response.

Three problems with this idea:

1.  What has Narrative, no matter who was in charge of the department, done with their fan community that even remotely suggests that they can be trusted?
2. I did this exact thing recently, gathering topics from fans to discuss with Narrative.  The end result?  Nothing from Narrative or anyone involved in creative.  They asked for suggestions, we provided them, and they took a huge dump on our collective work.
2. Ant in Oz mentioned that they don't read story ideas for (undisclosed) legal reasons.

So, no.  I *don't* trust them to read the forums, and I have pretty good reasons to believe so.
People have done so before, and it isn't the first time Riot has made a thread about what we want or how we see things. It's a fair criticism.
Your favorite faction isn't Leona? Blasphemy!

Also in light of recent mood of boards, personal opinions are bit risky.

The first part of this, very much. The art team is big now. Back in the day I used to know much of what's going on, but as one of the two primary concept artists on ChampUP we often deal with our specific teams most frequently. Luckily though our team interfaces with a lot of other teams so I do get to see the cool stuff that's going on :D

Also, that's why I'm usually able to pinpoint people who can better answer questions that I might not have the full skinny on.
